CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic and Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE ORG ( ORG ) expropriated a part of the applicant ’s plot of land . A committee of experts assessed the value of the plot of land and the relevant amount was paid to her .
CARDINAL . Following the applicant ’s request for increased compensation , on DATE ORG of First - instance awarded her additional compensation plus interest at the statutory rate .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing and quashed the judgment of the First - instance court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of First - instance awarded the applicant additional compensation of MONEY ( TRL ) plus interest at the statutory rate , running from DATE , applicable at the date of the court ’s decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing and upheld the judgment of ORG of First - instance .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request for rectification .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG paid GPE CARDINAL to the applicant .

CARDINAL . NORP The relevant domestic law and practice is described in the Aka v. GPE judgment of DATE ( Reports of Judgments and Decisions CARDINALVI , § § DATE ) . Moreover , under LAW no . DATE of DATE concerning enforcement and bankruptcy ( İcra ve PERSON ) , the property belonging to the ORG can not be seized or confiscated .
